content.webTitle: Sky Blues plunge into sea of red

fields.headline: Sky Blues plunge into sea of red
fields.bodyText: The Premiership football club lost £13.9m last season, up from £600,000 the year before, according to accounts filed at Companies House. The news comes amid rumours that Kevin Keegan, manager of the Sky Blues, is considering his future after the club's board denied him funds to buy new players. City's chairman David Bernstein said last week: 'We remain as ambitious as Kevin but we are restrained by certain realities.' Keegan has spent over £30m on 15 players during his 18-month tenure, including £13.5m on the striker Nicolas Anelka, a club record. City also made a £7m write-down on the value of its squad, partly as a reflection of the depressed transfer market. But there are bright spots. The club's income fell last year because it was relegated to the first division. It has since returned to the Premiership, and is moving to a new ground. If City avoids relegation this season, Bernstein predicts that once in the new stadium it will double turnover to £60m.
